Miles Sound System SDK 6.6h

AIL_enumerate_3D_providers

The function AIL_enumerate_3D_providers enumerates the available 3D providers for display or for opening.

S32 AIL_enumerate_3D_providers(
  HPROENUM *next,
  HPROVIDER *dest,
  char * *name
);

Out Parameters

next
is a pointer that MSS uses to keep track of the next provider to return. You initialize the next variable with the constant HPROENUM_FIRST before the first call to AIL_enumerate_3D_providers.
dest
points to an address that receives the HPROVIDER handle that is used for AIL_open_3D_provider.
name
receives a pointer to the provider's text description (such as "DirectSound3D software"). This return variable is usually used to add the text string to a list of user choices.

Returns

0, if no further M3D providers were found, non-zero if another provider was found.

Discussion

You should call this function before AIL_open_3D_provider to find out what 3D providers are installed on the system. If you know the specific provider that you want to find, you can use the AIL_find_3D_provider function.

The HPROVIDER handles returned by this function can change from one program execution to the next. For example, "Miles Fast 2D Positional Audio" may have the HPROVIDER handle value "1" during one execution, and the value "2" the next. You must, therefore, always use this function to obtain the proper HPROVIDER handle value at runtime. Note that on Xbox, you don't have to open a 3D provider - you can use the normal 2D HDIGDRIVER handle for all 3D operations. The 2D and 3D systems are integrated. Example files that use this function: EXAM3D.C


Group: 3D Digital Audio Services
Related Functions: AIL_enumerate_3D_providers, AIL_find_3D_provider, AIL_open_3D_provider
Related Basic Types: HDIGDRIVER, HPROENUM, HPROVIDER, S32, char *
Related FAQs: How do I open a 3D digital provider?
